timeline.message: Handle multi-line import and ones that do have .nf
Improve and add one more test
Fix checkstyle after temporarily adding it

timeline.bodyText: Should be a static, Pattern.compile is relatively expensive.
timeline.author: coverbeck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -141,6 +149,54 @@ public Version parseWorkflowContent(String filepath, String content, Set<SourceF
         return imports;
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Similar to processImports() of other handlers.
+     * The current processImports() method looks for main.nf and similar so is not suitable for recursion.
+     * Looks for imports by searching for lines that start "include"
+     * @param repositoryId  The Git repository (ex. nextflow-io/rnaseq-nf)
+     * @param content   The contents of the file being analyzed
+     * @param version   The Git version (branch/tag) of the repository
+     * @param sourceCodeRepoInterface   The source code repository interface
+     * @param workingDirectoryForFile   The parent directory of the file being analyzed
+     * @return
+     */
+    private Map<String, SourceFile> processOtherImports(String repositoryId, String content, Version version,
+            SourceCodeRepoInterface sourceCodeRepoInterface, String workingDirectoryForFile) {
+        Map<String, SourceFile> imports = new HashMap<>();
+        Pattern p = Pattern.compile("include.+?from.+?'.+?'", Pattern.DOTALL);

timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Functional side of me would rather have this return an Optional rather than the side-effect of updating a map. But we're not officially functional, and it was already like this.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: Agreed, but ya. it was already like this
replies.author: garyluu

timeline.bodyText:
I think this method is a good case for a unit test, to make sure it's catching the imports it's supposed to. Even though you already have integration tests.
It would be even better if we could use NextFlow for this, but we don't have their JAR on the classpath.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: Nextflow hasn't added support to return the imports nicely yet.
replies.author: Ldcabansay

replies.bodyText: Do like the unit test idea, if only to have a concrete example checked-in in case we change the examples on github (or is this coded for their original repos?)
replies.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: should be more specific if merging/squashing with develop
timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: will these tests break if nextflow-io changes things (or are these forked and I'm missing it?)
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: Yup, going to fork and create tag before merge
replies.author: garyluu

timeline.bodyText:
Pending Java 12, might be more readable as a resource file.
But I don't feel strongly about it, I think I can get the general idea here.
timeline.author: denis-yuen
coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Maybe should be             import path from CWL, NFL, etc.  file
